intro: Parageum bulgaricum, commonly known as the Bulgarian bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and features slender, branching stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, bell-shaped blue or violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. Parageum bulgaricum thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges.
